newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen steady.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan rupee ends down in kerb, seen steady.

text.p: The Pakistani rupee closed 0.15 down at 41.70 to the dollar on Monday but is likely to open steady on Tuesday, dealers said.
They said demand for the dollar was high but some profit-taking might set in at these levels and keep the rupee stable.
The State (central) Bank of Pakistan rate, last changed on May 23, was 40.3900/40.5920 rupees against the dollar.
The premium on foreign exchange bearer certificates closed at 3.0 percent, compared to previous close at 2.75 percent on Saturday. -- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
